091797-d-09-17-97-SFS.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 11:OO AM THE CREW SET CNJ 1158 OUT AT THE PLATFORM AT THE DEPOT IN SANTA FE.  THE BRAKEMAN SET THE HANDBRAKE AND CHOCKED WHEELS, FRONT AND BACK.  WHEN THE ENGINE PULLED AWAY IT LEFT CNJ 1158 IN  "EMERGENCY".  THE TRAIN CREW LEFT TO COMPLETE SWITCHING IN THE YARD.  AT APPROXIMATELY 2:00 PM THE SAME CREW WAS SWITCHING ANOTHER CAR INTO A SIDING.  4 MILES AWAY WHEN CNJ 1158 COLLIDED INTO BOX CAR BN 747600 AT AN ESTIMATED SPEED OF 20 MPH.  THE BOX WAS COUPLED TO ENGINE SFS 93.  DAMAGE WAS SUSTAINED ON BN 747600, CNJ 1158 TRACKS BOTH CARS WERE DERAILED IN THE INCIDENT.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO ANY PEOPLE INVOLVING  THIS INCIDENT.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE HANDBRAKE ON THE CNJ 1158 WAS KICKED OFF BY A PASSERBY EITHER INTENTIONALLY OR BY ACCIDENT.  THE FACT THAT THE WOODEN CHOCKHAD BEEN MOVED LEAD US TO BELIEVE THAT VANDALISM MAY HAVE BEEN A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ONCE COMPLETED, CONDUCTOR PROCEEDED BY HIGHWAY TO STONE CONTAINER ARRIVING WELL AHEAD OF THE VSRR 200/512.
